ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Improved writing skills due to the excellent feedback from the professor, and the readings and discussions helped to expand your perspective on the subject. For someone who hasn't read a lot of dense academic material, this course will help by introducing it to you in a controlled manner that you can dissect in class.

Oh I really learned so much. I learned how to properly structure an essay, how to conduct a close reading, how to corroborate theories across a topic and relate it to other fields of study. Really the perfect writing seminar.
I learned not only about the subject of nostalgia, but how to research and write papers based on research.

I learned how to read, write, and analyze academic texts, as well as explore various forms of essay-writing that are different from the typical essay. This allowed me to find the essay style that best suited me.

This course allowed me to further develop my writing skills in multiple styles, including argumentative, research, and creating writing. Specific to this course, I was able to engage and learn more deeply about nostalgia.
I learned the process on how to write a research paper and how to use use text within my essay for evidence and support.

I learned how to read academic papers and eventually write my own research paper at the end. Due to the highly discussion-based nature of the class, I learned a lot from the classmates around me, as well as about the topic of nostalgia.

I was taught how to write at the college level, given that previous writing structure was very different to the college style. I also learned how to write a research paper using close readings of critical works.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths include connecting people together to have thoughtful discussions about a shared topic of interest, presenting engaging material that builds up your ability to read scholarly work, and improving your overall writing ability. Weaknesses include a somewhat fast pace at the beginning.

This course was amazing. I found it to be the perfect balance of readings, analyzing theories from other scholars, and contributing our own ideas to the field. I thoroughly enjoyed how our class discussions were structured and found class to be invigorating. I really enjoyed listening to my classmates' perspectives, analyzing different texts, and engaging in discourse and meaningful research. I wouldn't change anything about this course.
This class is heavily discussion based which I believe is a strength as it makes the course very malleable and open to the students direction.

This course was very insightful and had a lot of interesting and different texts that really changed my understanding of nostalgia. The only weakness is that sometimes the texts were extremely hard to understand, but these texts were usually thoroughly explained in class.

I really liked the small, seminar-sized class size for this course. It allowed everyone to participate during class and I feel like we were able to effectively give feedback to each other. There were no noticeable weaknesses to this course. It was, overall, very organized and the pace did not feel too fast or too slow.
Receiving feedback on my writing was useful and helped me to improve. I also enjoyed the various texts we read. Sometimes the topic and discussion in class became repetitive.
The course was very organized and I enjoyed the readings very much. Although they were difficult, many of them were interesting and contributed to productive discussions.

The strengths was the ample support and resources provided throughout the course like the workshops and library visits which were helpful. A weakness could be the fast pace of writing assignments in the beginning of the year in which papers were due back to back.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, this is hands down the best course I have taken so far. Please take this class if you have even a remote interest in the subject. Your ability to think will improve with this class and you will leave a better writer.
I would definitely recommend this course to another student. Anyone who wants an introduction to academic writing would benefit greatly.
Yes I would because the class is very well taught and interesting. It adequately challenges the student yet fulfills their intellectual thirst.
Yes, I definitely would. It's a great class for anyone who is interested in learning about the topic/looking to improve their academic writing.

I would recommend this course to students who wish to improve their general writing skills. This course asks students to write for different purposes which will definitely come in handy in the future. The content, at least for this section, was very engaging and I really liked attending classes.
Yes it was an overall enjoyable writing course and I was able to learn different techniques
I would definitely recommend this course to anyone who wants a stronger foundation in college-level writing.
I would definitely recommend this course to others, as nostalgia is a very nuanced and interesting topic. The class was fun and enjoyable.
